titleInfo.title: Butcher Shop During Fire Prevention Week, City Beautiful Scrapbooks, 1957, Vol. 2 p. 74

mods.identifier: City Beautiful Vol 2 p74 Unidentified Grocery FPW 1957 001

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Photograph of Fire Prevention Week signs displayed in an unidentified butcher shop/grocery. Location unknown. Photographer unknown. Photograph used by the City Beautiful Commission of Nashville, Tennessee, 1957. The City Beautiful Commission was established by the Mayor and City Council in June of 1953, for the purpose of improving the sanitation, cleanliness, and overall appearance of the City of Nashville. The Commission later became a division of Metro Parks in 1975, and then a part of the Metro Public Works division in 2005. Forms part of the City Beautiful Commission Scrapbook Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
